attributes.action: Significantly increase funding for child and adolescent mental health services
attributes.additional_details:
Currently, CAMHS accounts for 0.7% of NHS funding and 6.4% of mental health funding (YoungMinds). This is despite the fact that:
• 20% of adolescents may experience a mental health problem in any given year.
• 50% of mental health problems are established by age 14.
• 10% of 5-16 year olds have a clinically diagnosable mental health problem. 
• 70% of children & adolescents with mental health problems have not had appropriate interventions at a sufficiently early age.
(Mental Health Foundation)
attributes.background:
Children are being failed daily by the current CAMHS system, they are unable to access care and the care they can access is of an unacceptable standard. 
This is a widespread issue largely due to funding and yet insufficient action has been taken. 
The government needs to make CAMHS a priority.
